snippet.textDisplay:
Now I am worried. I counted 8 writers! Why are 8 writers needed?
Via the Streams, the stories have already been fleshed out. It is not as if they are creating new stories from scratch. Why are 8 writers needed?
Vox Machina is composed of 7 characters, so, a writer or two would be enough to incorporate their side of the stories. Again, why are 8 writers needed?
snippet.textOriginal:
Now I am worried.  I counted 8 writers!  Why are 8 writers needed?  
Via the Streams, the stories have already been fleshed out.  It is not as if they are creating new stories from scratch.  Why are 8 writers needed?  
Vox Machina is composed of 7 characters, so, a writer or two would be enough to incorporate their side of the stories.  Again, why are 8 writers needed?

snippet.textDisplay: I don't think I have been this excited about an upcoming show to this level since childhood. Hopefully this ushers in a massive wave of D&D related series and TV shows. Being from the Deep South during the 80s Satanic Panic, it really is great to see my hobby exploding in popularity once again. So many times I wondered why someone hadn't done this before? It's so obvious that something like this would have been a hit.
snippet.textOriginal: I don't think I have been this excited about an upcoming show to this level since childhood. Hopefully this ushers in a massive wave of D&D related series and TV shows. Being from the Deep South during the 80s Satanic Panic, it really is great to see my hobby exploding in popularity once again. So many times I wondered why someone hadn't done this before? It's so obvious that something like this would have been a hit.

snippet.textDisplay:
Being inside that room must have felt like amazing, so different backgrounds but all amazing and talented people bursting with ideas.

One thing I didn't realize is how attached I am to the campaigns and its characters but also to the players and GM. It's like seeing old friends, that you never had the pleasure of meeting, making something great... again.

It is weird in the way that I feel proud of them. I have never met them and I'm not usually the fanboy type but I guess this is what means to be a critter. I can't wait for the series to come out.
snippet.textOriginal:
Being inside that room must have felt like amazing, so different backgrounds but all amazing and talented people bursting with ideas. 

One thing I didn't realize is how attached I am to the campaigns and its characters but also to the players and GM. It's like seeing old friends, that you never had the pleasure of meeting, making something great... again.

It is weird in the way that I feel proud of them. I have never met them and I'm not usually the fanboy type but I guess this is what means to be a critter. I can't wait for the series to come out.

snippet.textDisplay: Point of order: Someone did in fact translate their rpg campaign to an animated series long ago. It's called Record of Lodoss War, and was ultimately based on an original homebrew D&D setting and game played and made by the creator. Other than that little note, I love everything about this.
snippet.textOriginal: Point of order: Someone did in fact translate their rpg campaign to an animated series long ago. It's called Record of Lodoss War, and was ultimately based on an original homebrew D&D setting and game played and made by the creator. Other than that little note, I love everything about this.

snippet.textDisplay:
So far I haven't seen anything regarding the character on promotional stuff yet, but is it confirmed whether or not Tiberius will be part of the show? He was a somewhat important character throughout the first part, up to the briarwood arc and even afterwards remained an important figure to the members of VM when they visited Draconia. He was also the character that was used to display the power of Lady Briarwood, and since I heard their arc will also be adapted, I would assume Tiberius is part of it all?




EDIT: LOOKED IT UP ON KICKSTARTED AND TIBERIUS IS CONFIRMED OUT
snippet.textOriginal:
So far I haven't seen anything regarding the character on promotional stuff yet, but is it confirmed whether or not Tiberius will be part of the show? He was a somewhat important character throughout the first part, up to the briarwood arc and even afterwards remained an important figure to the members of VM when they visited Draconia. He was also the character that was used to display the power of Lady Briarwood, and since I heard their arc will also be adapted, I would assume Tiberius is part of it all?




EDIT: LOOKED IT UP ON KICKSTARTED AND TIBERIUS IS CONFIRMED OUT

snippet.textDisplay:
❤️❤️❤️The Beautiful Wife💓💓
.
.
.
She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and deliver-eth girdles onto the merchants.
25 Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.
26 She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.
27 She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
28 Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.
29 Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellent them all.
30 Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.
31 Give her of the fruits of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.
~Proverbs 31:24 By Kings with LOVE~
.
.
* You are honored and loved ❤️❤️❤️, created by the Most High LOVE. You are loved by Jesus enough to die for. Gift is the Holy Spirit. Intimacy, power, strength, joy may flourish. Seek He who is true love, that you may become LOVE.
snippet.textOriginal:

.
.
She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and deliver-eth girdles onto the merchants.
25 Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.
26 She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.
27 She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
28 Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.
29 Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellent them all.
30 Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.
31 Give her of the fruits of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates. 
~Proverbs 31:24 By Kings with LOVE~
.
.

snippet.textDisplay:
I don’t think the changes they plan to make are going to be extremely drastic. I imagine they’ll stick to the overall plot at least for anything related to the source material (meaning the episodes that contain the Briarwood arc and anything adapted after that like the Conclave arc and so on). If I’m not mistaken the prequel/original special is completely separate from the game itself so we don’t need to worry about that.

Whatever changes they do make will probably be just cutting things that aren’t needed and tweaking elements of the story to make it flow better. I bet Vax will still be an idiot and nearly get himself killed by the Briarwoods in Emon and then later run in by himself to save Cassandra without waiting for backup.

Edit: Though since Tiberius is not going to be in it they WILL have to change scenes with him in it. That will probably be the most major change we will have

Whatever changes they do make will probably be just cutting things that aren’t needed and tweaking elements of the story to make it flow better. I bet Vax will still be an idiot and nearly get himself killed by the Briarwoods in Emon and then later run in by himself to save Cassandra without waiting for backup.

Edit: Though since Tiberius is not going to be in it they WILL have to change scenes with him in it. That will probably be the most major change we will have

snippet.textDisplay: While I'm sure that partnering with Amazon Prime probably allowed this to happen in the first place, I'm a little disappointed to see that it's exclusive to AP. Not even because of me, I'd pay to watch it, but rather because I feel like there a lot of people that would love to see it, people who may not even know about Critical Role in the first place, that won't see it because it's Amazon Prime, and to most people that's just a delivery site. If it had been on Hulu or Netflix word would quickly spread, and I'm sure fans will spread the word, I just don't feel like Amazon is great for launching new material like this. Still looking forward to it more than pretty much anything else right now. Can't wait for a release date (at the same time, I can't rush it, take your time).
snippet.textOriginal: While I'm sure that partnering with Amazon Prime probably allowed this to happen in the first place, I'm a little disappointed to see that it's exclusive to AP. If it had been on Hulu or Netflix word would quickly spread, and I'm sure fans will spread the word, I just don't feel like Amazon is great for launching new material like this. Still looking forward to it more than pretty much anything else right now. Can't wait for a release date (at the same time, I can't rush it, take your time).

snippet.textDisplay: let me nerd for a minute, i found the dream game its an all DMs game and its sooo good death and tears and friendship and deep backstories. weve only just completed our first real mission of the campaign but its taken almost 10 sessions because of the awesome conversations that keep happening. we've got a tortle samurai as our tank whose a real sweetheart who doesn't know much about the world, and my character is an aasimar cleric who dreams of being a teacher so its like they were accidentally made to be buddies; and there is a human wizard who was disowned by her noble family who made friends with our previously dragonborn female friend who died, and was reincarnated as a human by roll of the die. whose death was really bad because they just declared their friendship the day before she was struck down, but its okay since shes back; but its not okay because we just ran into her FAMILY who don't know she died let alone that shes a human now and we have to help emotionally support her to explain what happened. oh and the main goal of my cleric is im an arcana domain cleric who dislikes that the wizarding colleges hold all of the educational power so i want to set up a general education system to improve the knowledge of the commoners and to do that schoolhouses would be too expensive so im long term working on a spell that riffs off Mordenkainen's magnificent mansion but to conjure a school house instead, i've been learning to create my own spells and my characters been kind of heavy hearted because he focuses on healing mostly because he doesn't want to lose his new friends but people keep going down x.x we've all cried allot and we owe people for ressurections but thats okay because murdering bad guys is okay if its for family

snippet.textDisplay:
It took me a few time to get into CR initially, the video length for my past self was intimidating to say the least. Also Vox Machina not initially starting on the internet and getting thrown into a campaign already in progress that was adjusted from Pathfinder to 5E is also jarring, but toughing it out I was finally able to get into it more and more. When the first campaign came to a close I was a bit sadden. It was like saying good-bye to characters that felt like family in a way.



When Campaign two started up I guess I was having a hard time getting use to what has come to be known as the "Mighty Nein." I thought I would have an easier time getting into campaign two since now everyone would get to see things from the beginning, but for me it felt even harder then campaign one for some reason. It's hard to put into words, the same people who play Vox Machina I knew, but now so unfamiliar. That may sound dumb, but I bailed for a bit. I also saw a bit of Vox Machina in the Mighty Nein and that two was playing on my feelings.



After a bit of a reprieve from CR, I jumped back into Campaign two starting back at beginning even though I watched the first few before I took my reprieve, but going in with more of an open mind. It took me a long while to start getting attached to the Mighty Nein and I say a bit before the fall of Molly is when it started taking place. From then on I was now invested into campaign 2 as I was with the first.



Even though they will change some stuff from what happened on the stream for this I don't see any problem with that. Like reading Manga and watching Anime there's differences that are in each. Comic characters have change over the decade that they've been around. As long as the underlining heart and soul of what make Vox Machina is still there then I'm going to enjoy this. I hope this makes way for more high fantasy cartoon, shows or what not in the future. I'm enjoying how much popularity Tabletop RPG's has gotten through recent years and hope it continues to grow.
snippet.textOriginal:
It took me a few time to get into CR initially, the video length for my past self was intimidating to say the least. Also Vox Machina not initially starting on the internet and getting thrown into a campaign already in progress that was adjusted from Pathfinder to 5E is also jarring, but toughing it out I was finally able to get into it more and more. When the first campaign came to a close I was a bit sadden. It was like saying good-bye to characters that felt like family in a way. 



When Campaign two started up I guess I was having a hard time getting use to what has come to be known as the "Mighty Nein." I thought I would have an easier time getting into campaign two since now everyone would get to see things from the beginning, but for me it felt even harder then campaign one for some reason. It's hard to put into words, the same people who play Vox Machina I knew, but now so unfamiliar. That may sound dumb, but I bailed for a bit. I also saw a bit of Vox Machina in the Mighty Nein and that two was playing on my feelings. 



After a bit of a reprieve from CR, I jumped back into Campaign two starting back at beginning even though I watched the first few before I took my reprieve, but going in with more of an open mind. It took me a long while to start getting attached to the Mighty Nein and I say a bit before the fall of Molly is when it started taking place. From then on I was now invested into campaign 2 as I was with the first. 



Even though they will change some stuff from what happened on the stream for this I don't see any problem with that. Like reading Manga and watching Anime there's differences that are in each. Comic characters have change over the decade that they've been around. As long as the underlining heart and soul of what make Vox Machina is still there then I'm going to enjoy this. I hope this makes way for more high fantasy cartoon, shows or what not in the future. I'm enjoying how much popularity Tabletop RPG's has gotten through recent years and hope it continues to grow.

snippet.textDisplay: 6:28 Its even better, Its like writting a Spider Man script with Spider Man in the room. Think about it. They didn't invent those characters and set them in a linear story from A to B. It all happened live, all those moments were what they were thinking at the moment. It was completely reactionary, no backtracking to create a better story was allowed. They in fact ARE those characters. Its more like adapting a docummentary, or an autobiography and interviewing the people its about about the script. Its not asking Stan Lee what he thinks the character he invented would have done, It's asking the characters what would they have done.
snippet.textOriginal: 6:28 Its even better, Its like writting a Spider Man script with Spider Man in the room. Think about it. They didn't invent those characters and set them in a linear story from A to B. It all happened live, all those moments were what they were thinking at the moment. It was completely reactionary, no backtracking to create a better story was allowed. They in fact ARE those characters. Its more like adapting a docummentary, or an autobiography and interviewing the people its about about the script. Its not asking Stan Lee what he thinks the character he invented would have done, It's asking the characters what would they have done.
